title: Introducing: Spirits Of Leo
content:
Why end of year lists are always published well before the end of the year continuously baffles me; how can anyone be so naive as to write off a fairly sizeable portion of the year? This new act from California (the project of Ryan Santos Phillips) goes to show exactly why you shouldn’t jump to conclusions, as Spirit of Leo explodes onto the scene with one of the finest underground releases of the year.

This debut four track EP is a glorious combination of everything that’s great about lo-fi ‘bedroom-style’ production, fusing a vast range influences into a product of immeasurable beauty.

Bringing about recollections of the likes of Pale Saints, Ride, and of course, a slightly more pop-orientated My Bloody Valentine, Spirits Of Leo is sincere, devastatingly honest and utterly beautiful. In more modern comparisons, there’s touches of Wild Nothing and Washed Out, in short, I’m lost for words.

I stood aside and watched the worlds collide 
it wasn’t easy, but I kept my arms open wide 
Crystalline, so pristine 
(Your eyes) 
In reflections, there’s endless imperfections 
don’t trust the mirror, bloody Mary likes to have her laughs 
Crystalline, so pristine 
(Your eyes)
